reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for Beginner Spanish Readers
reviews.reviewText: I have been searching for good books to begin my Spanish reading journey. Even children's books are difficult for me right now because I just don't know enough words in Spanish. This book was at the perfect level for me, and allowed me ample opportunity to learn many new words. This book also kept me very entertained. I will definitely be searching for more books by Joe Arenas.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I am currently learning Spanish. This was great book to learn with while reading interesting stories. The short chapters kept me entertained.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars As Far As I Can Tell
reviews.reviewText: As far as I can tell it's great. I'm a beginner though so idk how accurate it is. There could be errors, so I'll do my best to check as I read.The chapters are very short, and at the end of the book there are comprehension questions with answers.I look forward to using this book to learn.I only have it 4 stars because I don't know enough spanish to definitely give it 5 stars.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars What a fun way to learn!
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed both of these stories. They are much more enjoyable than most beginning readers! I love the horror genre. Most excellent.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great book for someone trying to learn Spanish!
reviews.reviewText: This is the second book I have been reading from this author, and I am very impressed with his work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2021
reviews.reviewText: It's simple for the most part. I use both sides since I teach both languages. It could use some editing in a couple of pages. Other than that, it's pretty good. Both stories are on the scary side. One has a dead baby, the other has a bunch of spiders. Simple tenses, mostly in the present tense, but some present perfect as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2022
reviews.reviewText: This was a very good book that definitely helped me in my learning of the Spanish language. I, especially, love the quizzes!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Awkward translation and errors throughout
reviews.reviewText: This is more like a children's book than anything I would consider a "short novel". There are only about 10 sentences per page and they are mostly very short sentences. It's 140 pages, but that's only 70 if you consider that there's a Spanish and English version of each page, so it's just not very much content for the price. There are awkward and clunky translations throughout. In addition, it's just full of errors. On nearly every page there are at least a few small errors such as missing spaces, but also some typos like "LLightning". There are also grammatical errors like "Lightning illuminate the room" instead of "Lightning illuminates the room".Overall, I would say it is an interesting way to learn and I understand the need for short, simple sentences and not much plot in a book for language learners. But with all the errors and clunky writing, it's just not worth the price.
Good to learn vocabulary, intriguing story-line, minor errors in the book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 5, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: Page turner that motivated me to read more.
reviews.reviewText: I'm fairly low level but this was written to help me ease into extended reading. I used a dictionary just every so often. I learned useful new expressions and saw new grammar I hadn't studied before. I felt the book was really helping my Spanish. Thank you!

reviews.reviewTitle: Entertaining book, lots of white space to add notes
reviews.reviewText: True beginner book but still trying to make the stories fun for teens/adults. I like horror so this was perfect for me. Short sentences. 2 page chapters double spaced. Words used in repetition to assist learning. Loses a star because some words didn't get precisely translated into English, my Colombian friends says - but maybe its Mexico n or spain colloquialism. Idk.
